content: This game has the potential to be great, but the frustration of manipulating the screen to zoom in, out, or travel to different parts of the island is so clunky, it's impossible to enjoy the game. content: The classic Tropico experience brought to life on mobile. Nearly identical to the PC version of Tropico 3, which is a good thing considering how good that game was. content: It's worth mentioning that this game is actually a port of Tropico 3, and not a new tropico game, still a great game non the less. *Pros*: It's Tropico 3 on your phone and on the go, even comes with the expansion pack. The port job is solid and is optimized really well, runs great on my Galaxy S9. The UI is moblie friendly and never feels cluttered even on a smaller screen. *Cons*: Camera controls feels awkard at first and takes a while to get used to. The timeline feature isn't in this port.

Constant freezing and crashing. Couldn't even finish the tutorial. I am so disappointed as I LOVE the tropico games and I have a phone that is reasonably new and should be powerful enough. (It is for every other game and app!) P20 Pro. A real shame and disappointment.

content: Had initial issue installing the game. My wifi would timeout and become inactive, I had to keep an active connection for the download to work. But since then the game has had no issue and runs fantastically. I hope they keep bringing more PC games to Mobile.

These are the games I would like to see more of. You pay up front and have full access. The app store is littered with garbage pay to win games and spyware. Good to finally see something of substance. Happy to cost for this.

Cool concept, terrible experience. I have a samsung galaxy and this game does not work. Its laggy & glitchy. It freezes & you have to push the same button atleast 3 times for it to register. I love the idea of paying for a game outright, without micro transactions & pay to win features.... if the game works. I think the price should be lowered dramatically until the game runs smoothly & is playable. Thankfully google play was able to refund me on the purchase.
its a great game but starts to lag when the population is already too high when playing in a large map,

Feral really knocked it out of the park. One of the best ports and overall game I've played on Android. Controls are great for touch screen. Really hope they come back to port Tropico 4. No issues to report here and am happy customer.
Considering its for mobile, its amazing and a great time killer. Recommended for Tropico fans.

Viva Tropico! I love me some SimDictator and now I can play it on the go. The bad part of this game is the menu lag and controls. You click on a menu (build, edicts, almanac) and it takes a sec to load up the menu which definitely kills the flow of the game. Also, building can be a chore to position the buildings just right and it gets tough when you're trying to pack them together. Finally, the building menu cuts off the upgrades so it's a pain to see the different options. Please fix! 4/5
This brings back memories. Runs smoothly on my Huawei P30 mobile phone. Good job!
Excellent port of an excellent game, albeit with performance issues. Would like to see some graphics options to help optimise the experience

Can't add to the other reviews here, this is exactly what premium gaming should be, self-contained, IAP-free, stable, and complete. Well done, Devs, for bucking the P2W mechanics poisoning the Play Store, I'm happy to pay sensible one-off prices for polished releases like this. This is a gem, how do we make it Editor's Choice so other Devs can learn and we can fix mobile gaming? :-D (Oh, and can we give Feral Bullfrog's back catalogue next? Theme Hospital, Syndicate, etc...! ;-) )

Everything I love about Tropico now in mobile form!

Very happy to have mobile tropico

Recommended if you are a Tropico fan and a fan of mobile games but are tired of the games companies play by making you pay to win.

Worth every penny. This is the Pinnacle and shining example of what premium mobile gaming should be. Runs like a dream and looks top notch on Pixel 2 and it's ACTUALLY TROPICO. Not a slimmed down port. Not a crappy ad and IAP filled trash heap. This is a full game and I'm loving it.

This is a port of Tropico 3 Absolute Power from the PC. It's a pretty damn good port too really surprised me. The game is complete no ads or micro transactions. Definitely worth a buy even at its price range. You're pretty much getting a PC game on your phone. Update: The game is missing the electrify upgrade for appartment buildings. content: Okay, so this is a great game with complex managing mechanics. The reason I'm giving it a 3 star is because it's a lousy port. For it's price, the game is poorly ported. Camera controls are clunky and you often end up doing what you don't want to. No option to tweak graphics in the menu ( I had to edit the game's config file to get better visuals. Lastly, there's too much going on on screen, even on a large screen it feels like there are always too many icons that keep you from appreciating it.

I started to become a fan of tropico when I played it on ps4, tropico 5. This version, I should say is not bad for a game that has been adjusted for mobile gaming. I read that this was based from tropico 3? So yeah, not bad for a mobile version. Also, the controls were difficult to get a grip on during the first few hours but after many hours of play, I got the hang of it.
This game is great. I have always loved Tropico, so I really enjoy playing it on my phone. It runs smooth and looks beautiful on my LG Thinq G7.
Great graphics and great work to bring a pretty similar experience from other platforms to android. Early navigation frustrates but it gets fantastic once you figure it out which is quite easy
I've wanted mobile Tropico for years, thank god it's not plagued by microtransactions or any other common mobile port problems.

Great game. I have played tropico from the first PC release to more recent console releases and the mobile version ticks all the same boxes. Great visuals, the music once again is spot on, controls took a bit of getting used to but after the first scenario It feels intuitive, road laying is simple once you get the hang of it. The architect mode is perfect for mobile and makes placing buildings quick and easy. Good work feral once again!!
CAN'T LOAD SAVED GAMES. Single-serving play only. Ugh.

We are sorry that you are experiencing a problem with the game.

content: The game ia epic, loving it! But i have one or two issue. The controls are a bit funny and or clanky, and please add 21:9 screen ratio to the game! I have an Xperia One.

This game is great! So far no crashes for me. However I am playing it on Google 3XL due to the notch certain items cannot be clicked. Is there anyway to change the game screen size/ration enough to miss the notch?

Another solid port by Feral Interactive. Rome: Total War was awesome and now I am very happy to be playing Tropico on my phone. Both fantastic and looking forward to more. Keep the true PC ports coming! Happy to keep paying for quality! Thank you for standing out from the PTW BS games that flood the Play Store!

Absolutely love it. Tropico in my pocket! Okay so this is my first purchase of a premium game and I've been glued for a week already, at first I held off because of the comments about controls being clunky I would say it's a actually a learning curve for all touch screen based games, after 10 mins of playing you shouldn't have a problem. If you're a fan of building type games it would be a mistake not to have this absolutely beautiful game in your pocket at all times. THANKS SO MUCH FOR THIS !!

the BEST mobile port of ALL the pc ports on the playstore. its a port of tropico 3, im not sure why its just called "tropico", regardless, its a phenominal display of a proper mobile port. controls adjustments aswell as porting over the ENTIRE games campaign and features amount to the ideal mobile port of a pc game, all the triple a devs should take note on how you do a phone port, none of this card game adaptation or micro transaction nonsense. thanks feral :)

The app was great, but it wasn't for me. If you love Tropico, though, you will love this game. Great controls, gameplay, and stunning graphics for a mobile game. Give it a try, and you might end up falling in love.
LOVE this game! It is exactly the same (except with new scenarios) as the PC game, I played years ago, on PC!! Thank you for making a much loved PC game, for mobile without changing a thing!

To start i enjoy the game i have been playing this series for a few years and the concept is what draws me in so naturally when i saw the mobile release i was lit up with joy and baught it almost instantly. Now the problems i have with this is really just the controls and the U.I maybe its because the game technically isn't suported on my device so i guess ill just wait for updates and hope for the best

Feral Support

content: Awesome gameplay, the controls are not clunky, this game meets my expectations. Only two things that need to be fixed: 1. Whenever I zoom/rotate the camera while in the architect mode, I suddenly get glitched many miles away from my initial position. 2. The game won't let me load my savegames, it keeps me in an endless loadingscreen instead. I'm playing on a Nubia Red Magic 3. I thank you in advance for taking care of the issues. EDIT: Issue number 2. only refers to sandbox mode savegames.

Love the game. Nice to see these types of game for the phone. Pros and cons -great graphics. - very detailed and in depth gameplay. - controls are not clunky or frustrating by any means. Like any new game just have to get use to it -pricey for a game that doesn't seem to have the basics covered. -dont bother saving because reloading is not an option. Glitches and does not load. Kinda pointless for a game that takes so much time, makes replay value drop. All in all good but needs work.

content: Tropico for mobile is an absolute hidden gem in its own right to have and play on the go and I love it. It has nearly every element that you'd expect from the original and newer pc versions of the game and it surprisingly works great even on modern unsupported devices. My only complaints would be that the controls are slightly annoying when building and especially placing roads, doesn't seem to have age advancement, no traffic lights or stop signs at intersections, and not much space to build..
It's Tropico 3 ported! I'd like to see lights on the buildings during night time. I'd also like the implementation of online elements, like creating own island and trading/battle with other players.
Clunky, not my favorite port. I think I'll stick to Tropico 3 / 4 on PC

content: Perfect port i recommend this game to any Tropico fan i can't wait for your nxt game Feral interactive team for you make the impossible reality.

Finally, waited for a long time for a game that doesn't require pay to win and can be played offline. Awesome graphics, great music and funny comments. Use to play the franchise on the computer years ago. I don't understand the people complaining about the controls, yes it's different than the other games, but that makes it special and you can totally get used to it after a few hours. This will be a time killer for years to come! Thank you Feral entertainment! Money well spent!

I wanted to try Tropico out before buying it on the PC and I've got to say, what have I been doing all these years to miss this game? For android the standard is amazing and it's clear there's been a huge amount of work put into this. Will definitely be purchasing Tropico 6 on the PC after trying this out. The only slight negative is when the island is pretty built up it can get a little laggy but not so much that it is a problem. Controls aren't an issue. Tutorials were helpful. 4.9/5 for me.

It's just great. The graphics, the complexity just as in the pc version is there. It's a high quality game and I have not seen this level of depth in a mobile game. It does take time to get used to the controls but they are very well made.

Very good mobile port love it just like the console and pc version ....people are complaing avout control cuz their phones arent good enough to run the game ...Control afe actually intuitive and quick once you get hang of it ...also they offer a bunch of customization for controls so nobody should be complaining about controls ...

Very pleased with the game. It's difficult but I'm new to the franchise so still getting my head around things. I'm surprised there isn't a graphics options screen to adjust details. The graphics are fine but I'd love to boost them right up! Looking forward to playing more!
lag lag, so jet laaaaaaaaagggg... ~

content: Thank you for finally bringing a decent city builder to the mobile platform. The controls will take some getting used to but for the brief time i was able to play it looks and plays smoothly. I deleted all the pay to advance games. My nights on the couch with the mrs are filled!
Good to see premium games on Android. Fan of Tropico, good port all in all.

I only see it doesnt run smoothly. And i have s9+ i think it should run without problems. Since i run both Rome total wars perfectly. Other then that its great port. Well done feral. Only 3 games i purchased for mobile, are 3 ports from feral.
Very good job but the control can be improved. I dont like the bottom ui is very big consume my viewing, can be just an icon for the menu bottom.
The games is awsome the control is a little bit stiff needs to be tweaked a little bit

Don't know why everyone is complaining about the controlls. I found it fine. Zoom in to click on a person. Hold your finger yo bring up the quick wheel. It's heaps better then 99% of the games in the play store at the moment. Great job and a great port. People complaining must be playing this on a tiny screen. Best on bigger screens.

Gameplay: I did hated the controls for the first hours... nearly went to refund! , but you get used to the UI very quick, now I love it, is actually very intuitive and it has some tricks like the wheel and the fingers movement Pros: 10/10 game, music , worth the cash Cons: You'll need a longer battery, My device has problems when reaching 500 it slows down a bit its a 845 Just give it a try ;) There's a gesture that you have to do in the UI to cheat, cool but I would much rather a Cheat Menu!
Are the controls as bad as the others are saying? No. Should the negative reviewer's wipe the grease off their stubby little fingers to make it easier? Yes
Game looks amazing! Major problem with the game saves, they just won't load.

content: Love this game! I have a Samsung Note 10+ and have no problems playing it, I can even use the S-pen for some of the game play.

Amazing. I do not think the controls are clunky and am actually very surprised at how well Feral pulled this off. The graphics are nice, and everything you expect from Tropico is there. Tropico is my favorite series and I have played them all. This is a solid port in my opinion, and like any game, once you get use to the controls, it does not feel clunky at all. Good job Feral. This game deserves to be at the top of list.
Great and awesome
Need to be updated, especially the control

Been a fan of Tropico and have played other versions before. However this port does look beautiful, it needs work. Controls are clunky. Just laying a road is a challenge. I hope things can be tightened up in an update. There is just too much going on the screen at once, too many buttons. Menus need to be better organized etc. Other than that the game is great. Has potential to be 5 star but requires just a little more work. After messing with the sensitivity settings, the app is more responsive

This is the best thing to ever happen to mobile games. If you are a tropico fan this is a must have. I've been playing since tropico first came out and this is a perfect addition. The graphics are still gorgeous. Placing buildings is easy especially with the new architect mode. Being able to see distances between important buildings makes it easy to plan the layout of your island. Having more control over El Presidente is fantastic. Nothing has felt clunky or frustrating. Mobile game of the year
God, this game is hard to navigate to the point I had anxiety.
